Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2015 07:31PM Cancersux1990 wrote: Thank you all for your support, I will try and get her to join this forum. I know as someone who doesn't have it I cannot relate to what she is feeling, but as her son I am very scared for me, her my young 14 year old sister and 17 year old brother, and the rest of our family. She needs to talk to people who can relate. We are being very positive and hopeful it is not in her organs, it is estrogen positive we do not know it anything else till the other test come in. There is one thing I am upset about my mom had to take the charge and made them give her the scan or else they mostly likely wouldn't of found it till it was in the organs.They say she can live for 5-10-20 years with this...thats still not enough time...I hate the not knowing what comes next...cancer is the worse.
Posts.Title: Well...bad news Cancersux1990 RonnieKay

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2015 06:56PM Cancersux1990 wrote: Hello, Well my mom is HER 2 - ER + they are going to give her a new drug that has just been approved we are very hopefully about it as are the doctors, they said it has very good results compared to other treatment. I will tell you hows it going and the name of the new drug as soon as I know.

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2015 02:44PM Cancersux1990 wrote: Yes her cancer is lobular. I know I have to stop looking up prognosis's because it is so different for everyone.
Posts.Title: Well...bad news Cancersux1990 RonnieKay

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2015 08:31PM Cancersux1990 wrote: Thank you very much, we are going to a group therapy appt. next week after we meet with her doctor to discuss her treatment plan...I too feel like our life will never be the same, but I guess I should of realized that in dec. 2010 when she was first dx. with stage 3 breast cancer. I just know I am going to cherish the days we have left and make them all count! We will still go on vacations we will still have fun we are not going to let cancer disrupt our lives! Thank you all.

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2015 01:51PM Cancersux1990 wrote: My mother is taking it. She started last week. The doctors are very happy because they said it has amazing results with very little to no symptoms but low white blood cell counts. So far she is doing great she feels normal and life is going on as usually. We are hoping it stays like this. We go to meet her doctor the 5th! She only pays 5 dollars a month for it as well!
